content.question: Let <math> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math> for 0 ≤ x ≤ 3. (a) Use the trapezoidal rule with four equal subdivisions of the closed interval [0,1] to approximate F(1).

frqParts.text: Let <math> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math> for 0 ≤ x ≤ 3. (a) Use the trapezoidal rule with four equal subdivisions of the closed interval [0,1] to approximate F(1).
(b) On what intervals is F increasing?

(c) If the average rate of change of F on the closed interval [1,3] is k, find <math> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math> in terms of k.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
